abstract: Federal District Court Judge Thomas D Schroeder will rule on challenge to changes in North Carolina election law, case that could have far-ranging implications for voting rights across country; civil rights advocates charge that new rules are deliberately designed to exclude black voters, who tend to vote Democratic, and say case is key test under Voting Rights Act.
lead_paragraph: The Department of Justice and civil rights groups said North Carolina sought to suppress black voting, while the state defended its right to set election rules.

headline.main: Key Voting Rights Test Now in Federal Judge’s Hands
headline.print_headline: Crucial Test Involving Voting Rights Goes to Judge

snippet: The Department of Justice and civil rights groups said North Carolina sought to suppress black voting, while the state defended its right to set election rules.

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
keywords.name: organizations
